title: can Riot respond to my problem..
body:
Riot please respond to me.. i have been banned since 8 months.. i also requested you to unbanned me also, now i'm Reformed.
i request in the support system for unbanned my account. I hope you respond to my problem that i'm going thru.

Thank you.

replies.body: Unfortunately, Riot does not unban accounts at this time unless the ban was mistakenly placed. I know that's not fun to hear, but reforming does *not* entitle you to regain your permanently banned accounts under the current system.

> [{quoted}](name=The Djinn,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=Hpof0Fcy,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2019-01-13T04:26:21.729+0000)
>
> Unfortunately, Riot does not unban accounts at this time unless the ban was mistakenly placed.

Quit spreading this lie. {{sticker:sg-ahri-1}} 

That hasn't been true for about 5 seasons. If OP sends a ticket to RS they could get reduced from a perma to a long suspension, which has been known to happen on enough occasions. It doesn't matter if its a very low chance of happening, merely that it is a chance of happening.

That's not even mentioning the mass unbans they did.

> [{quoted}](name=ı Sona ı,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=Hpof0Fcy,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2019-01-13T04:35:52.282+0000)It doesn't matter if its a very low chance of happening, merely that it is a chance of happening.

Official policy is that Riot does not unban accounts. While exceptions exist, I will continue to provide information as per official policy.

> [{quoted}](name=The Djinn,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=Hpof0Fcy,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2019-01-13T04:38:16.456+0000)
>
> Official policy is that Riot does not unban accounts. While exceptions exist, I will continue to provide information as per official policy.

Yes and some policies say X can't be held liable for accidents that happen on premise however x can still be sued for neglect. Also where does official policy say no one gets unbanned ever. I've read official policy saying they give players every chance to reform. 

Every chance.

{{sticker:sona-playing}}

> [{quoted}](name=ı Sona ı,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=Hpof0Fcy,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2019-01-13T05:23:22.658+0000)Also where does official policy say no one gets unbanned ever.

To my knowledge it isn't written out anywhere, but it's pretty clearly not the intent that a permanent ban be reversed. From **Riot Tantram:**

>[We don't want these players to make new accounts. A perma-ban is our way of exiting a player from the community. We just don't have any way to keep them from coming back.](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/mfIbceyR-permbanned-riot-refuses-to-provide-anything-about-previous-2-week-ban?comment=0000000000000000000000010000)
>
>[We don't want money from toxic players. We want them to stop playing.](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/d2M1uX57-instant-noreason-permanent-ban?comment=000400030003)

Given that he is one of the individuals in charge of this, one would think that, if reforming and gaining an account back were an option that was at all official, he would have mentioned it *ever*.

>I've read official policy saying they give players every chance to reform. 

Up to the final permanent ban, yes.

> [{quoted}](name=The Djinn,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=Hpof0Fcy,comment-id=00010000000000000000,timestamp=2019-01-13T05:28:43.172+0000)
>
> To my knowledge it isn't written out anywhere.

I'm just saying then, its hard to buy it as official policy if it isn't official policy with so many cases contradicting it.

You’re pretty helpful when it comes to players’ punishments. 

While it would be helpful to include the exceptions to the “no unbans unless in error,” I think the exceptions are pretty rare in comparison to when the bans were appropriately placed. I think discussing anything but the player’s own actions can reduce their focus on why they were punished, and thus reduce the chance of the player reforming.

> [{quoted}](name=Periscope,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=Hpof0Fcy,comment-id=00010000000000000001,timestamp=2019-01-13T06:10:35.374+0000)
>
> You’re pretty helpful when it comes to players’ punishments. 
> 
> While it would be helpful to include the exceptions to the “no unbans unless in error,” I think the exceptions are pretty rare in comparison to when the bans were appropriately placed. I think discussing anything but the player’s own actions can reduce their focus on why they were punished, and thus reduce the chance of the player reforming.

The exceptions are rare, I having been one of those apart of the Banned in Error and Ban Overturned group. Something something squeak wheel gets the grease, you know? 

Some players simply lose the wheel, sometimes they get the grease.

There are no "mass unbans".

Nobody has ever been unbanned unless it was due to an error, which is rare.

Before you bring up scum like T1, that was not an account ban, it was an immediate blanket ban for all accounts made by the individual, no second chances. When he "reformed" it was lifted due to media pressure. It will probably descend again eventually.

> [{quoted}](name=MagicFlyingLlama,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=Hpof0Fcy,comment-id=000100000001,timestamp=2019-01-13T05:08:01.291+0000)
>
> There are no "mass unbans".
> 
> Nobody has ever been unbanned unless it was due to an error, which is rare.
> 
> Before you bring up scum like T1, that was not an account ban, it was an immediate blanket ban for all accounts made by the individual, no second chances. When he "reformed" it was lifted due to media pressure. It will probably descend again eventually.

You are unaware of the highly successful mass unban experiment? {{sticker:sg-lux-2}}

There was no "highly successful mass unban experiment".

There was this: https://old.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/9356yc/why_are_people_in_na_having_their_permabanned/e3bbx8j/

It was a very small number of players, it failed horribly, and according to general babble a lot of the higher profile cases just got banned again.

It was ended as a failure because (surprising nobody) trash is going to keep being trash as soon as any positive incentive is removed, and due to a unmanageable huge volume of spammy/brat meltdown tickets.
3 weeks ago Riot said they are still [assessing their data](https://boards.euw.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behaviour-en/dtAVy66c-na-unban-experiment-has-failed?comment=000b).
nice link{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

It wasn't successful. Sorry. 
Riot made it clear that it wasn't. Especially due to the large amount that ended up coming back to this board.

> [{quoted}](name=Zombie Gerbil,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=Hpof0Fcy,comment-id=00010000000100000001,timestamp=2019-01-13T05:36:06.400+0000)
>
> It wasn't successful. Sorry. 
> Riot made it clear that it wasn't. Especially due to the large amount that ended up coming back to this board.

Large number? I can only think of 1 I saw.
What you saw and what Riot stats are too huge different.

> i also requested you to unbanned me also, now i'm Reformed.

It doesn't work like that. If you got permabanned, as the name suggests, the ban is **permanent**.

You are free to create a new account but the permabanned account stays banned.

Good thing Riot doesn't do requests when it comes to unbanning.
You're simply just going to have to move on from that account. Should have simply obeyed the rules. They're not even complex to understand.
All it takes is common courtesy, Self-control, and positivity. If none of those, just simply say nothing. Easy peasy lemon squeezy.

as far as I know unbanning someone is rare, especially depending on the circumstances and what you were banned for.

if you received a perma ban...then good luck.

No, Riot don't give a god damn fuck if you kill yourself because you are called a %%%%%% in multiple times and told that you should fucking die. Riot uses their automated bullshit and thinks they are protecting vulnerable young people. Maybe ONE DAY they will learn that they are just enabling this behavior!!!
